meta-review.comment:
Hippo Penny -

Get ready to hang ten and relive the radical '90s with Tony Hawk's Pro Skater 1 + 2! This remastered masterpiece is like a warm hug from an old childhood buddy - it's that good. With its fresh visuals, smooth gameplay, and iconic soundtrack, this game is a love letter to the past while still feeling current.

I'm not saying I'm cynical about Activision's business strategy (wink-wink), but when a game nails so much of what made the original experience great, it's hard not to be impressed. The load times might be a teensy bit long, and some folks might be missing their favorite level goals, but trust me, those pesky skaters will keep you coming back for more.

And let's talk about those challenges! Tony Hawk's Pro Skater 1 + 2 is all about variety and having fun. With over 700 challenges to complete, there's plenty to sink your teeth into. Plus, the multiplayer option is a blast - get ready to shred with friends online!

Of course, not everyone might be thrilled (ahem, IGN), but overall, this game is a triumph. It's like Activision took a step backward in time and ended up taking two giant leaps forward instead.

So, if you're looking for a rad way to spend your afternoon (or weekend, or month...), look no further than Tony Hawk's Pro Skater 1 + 2. It's the perfect blend of old-school fun and new-school excitement. And who knows? You might just find yourself feeling like a kid again, re-experiencing the joy of playing through these classic levels for the first time.

But don't just take my word for it - check out what some other critics had to say:

* IGN: "It's difficult to believe they share even a shred of DNA." (Okay, maybe I'm a bit cynical)
* GameSpot: "Smart additions and an engaging challenge system make it an experience that's more than just a brief skate through Tony Hawk's past."
* Gaming Age: "Tony Hawk Pro Skater 1 and 2 is easily one of the best remasters available on the market today..."
* Worth Playing: "It has trimmed most of the fat that's typical of these projects and unapologetically focused on its original core experience, and the results are all the better for it."

You get the idea - this game is a winner! So grab your board, put on your best Tony Hawk impression (you know you've got one), and get ready to ride the rails into nostalgia heaven.
